headline: Baked Turkey Tetrazzini
description: Transform your leftover turkey into a creamy and filling turkey tetrazzini with plenty of vegetables and seasoning for a tasty weeknight meal.
name: Baked Turkey Tetrazzini
recipeIngredient: 0.5 (8 ounce) package egg noodles, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 3 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir mushrooms, onion, and celery until tender, 5 to 10 minutes. Sprinkle flour over mushroom mixture and stir to coat.

Mix milk, cream cheese, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and nutmeg into mushroom mixture; cook, stirring occasionally, until cream cheese is melted and sauce is warmed, 5 to 10 minutes. Add turkey and peas to sauce.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook egg noodles in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 5 minutes. Drain and mix noodles into turkey mixture; pour into the prepared baking dish.
Combine Parmesan cheese, bread crumbs, and 3 tablespoons melted butter together in a bowl until crumbly; sprinkle over noodle mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until top is browned and sauce is bubbling, about 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: OK, I followed the recipe somewhat, lol I added some peas and carrots as well as some mix veggies that I had left over frozen. Instead of bread crumbs I put some left over stuffing on top and added a little curry powder and garlic for some more taste. It is a little bland on its own. Over all it was pretty good.

This recipe was a good base. The only part of the recipe that I did not follow was the bread crumb topping. In general the dish needed more seasoning, more salt, maybe some heat (red pepper flakes or something). or some acid, but something to enhance the flavor, just a smidge
Brian and I really liked this recipe. Added 2 habanero peppers and 1 chili pepper.
I made it but subbed broccoli for the peas and added some Tuscany seasoning to the bread crumbs

Made as written and it was a big hit! Very tasty. While not difficult to make, I agree with other reviews that it results in a lot of dishes clean up for something served in a single dish. Next time, I’ll do twice the topping mixture.

I didn't eat more than the original plate served...was not a huge fan, but hubby liked it. There were so many steps to this recipe with so many moving parts that definitely the result was not worth it to me.
I enjoyed this! I definitely think I’ll be making this again. I used unsweetened cashew milk to lower the calories :-)
Found it to be a bit dry. Flavour was good so next time I will add more liquid.
Simply a great way to use leftover turkey. My family loved it. I prepared as directed. Will definitely make again.

Served over gluten free pasta noodles, low sodium chicken stock, left over turkey gravy, left over mashed potatoes for the thickener, added veggies on hand: asparagus, spinach, mushrooms, peas & carrots. Since GF pasta noodles get super fragile if over cooked we did not bake. It was fabulous and we'll make it again using items on hand. Love that AR is a great source for ideas.
Very easy recipe. Made it in individual serving ramekins, looked and tasted great!

This was just okay. Kind of a standard noodle casserole - you could sub chicken or tuna. I thought it had a vaguely sweet taste that I didn't care for - not sure if that was from the cream cheese or maybe the Worchestershire? My husband didn't notice that, but he added hot pepper flakes.

And to whoever said they didn't make it because the recipe doesn't state the servings, it does - 6. But I agree that it's hard to find on the page AND the number of servings does not print with the recipe.

Turned out great! I doubled the recipe and froze half for a later time. Used 24 ounces peas and 12 ounce box of bow tie pasta. Probably closer to 7 or 8 cups turkey and Italian style panko bread crumbs. Everyone had seconds and there is enough left for a few lunches.
Added about 1/4 Cup of milk before baking also added bread crumbs and cheddar cheese it turned out amazing
Very delicious. Best way to use up the big leftover of turkey.
Delicious
When my husband tells me “you can make that again “ it’s a keeper recipe??

To clarify the ingredient list: Use 8 ounces of egg noodles and 4 ounces of cream cheese.

This recipe was good -- certainly not spectacular -- and it used up all the leftover Thanksgiving turkey. The topping, if made as written, is very dry, so if I ever make it again, I'm either going to use more butter or do something else to improve that.

In my case, I followed the recipe exactly. I'm pretty sure that you could increase the amount of turkey if you have more to use up. Four or even five cups would probably work just as well.

As others have mentioned, this requires a lot more time and effort than you'd expect, and you have a lot of cookware to clean when you're done. Overall, I feel that if I'm going to do that much work, I want a bigger reward. We enjoyed it, but honestly, it's just OK.
Real comfort food! I did use reconstituted dried mushrooms bcz I like the texture. And I made a little more topping. Again, texture. Delicious!
Wouldn’t make any changes. Delicious
A lot of work. Needs more liquid
Best Turkey Tetrazzini so far I've ever made .
Added more peas and some grated parmesan cheese. Was glad that I followed the instructions for using only a half package (8 oz.) of pasta.
I would make this again

I make a similar recipe: turkey broth in place of milk, add 1 cup grated Monterrey Jack cheese, 3 cloves of grated garlic, a can of diced black olives and 1 cup white wine. If it is dry add more broth, to soupy, simmer longer. This does take some time to make.

I prepared this dish for a work social (used all my left over turkey! Hooray!) I used more milk to make it a little more creamy and it turned out very good. I'm happy to report that every bit got eaten, and a few asked for the recipe! Success!
Easy to make and tasted great. Thank you
Didn't make any changes and we loved it even the third night.

Very tasty and easy to make. I had some leftover gravy from the turkey and used that together withthe milk to measure 3.5 cups liquid and also used a little bit more of the pasta. Used panko crumbs and also put a tablespoon of jalapeño cream cheese together with the rest of the cream cheese. It was delicious
Easy, and very yummy! We loved it and plan to make it again!
It was absolutely delicious. Even my husband loved it!!!
This was a terrific use of my leftovers ! I used half the cream cheese and added some shredded sharp cheddar. It turned out great! This will be my yearly go-to recipe!
Was a little dry, so I added turkey gravy and it was great.
It was very good. You can’t eat veg much. It was very rich.
I made this exactly from the recipes.. it was Delish! Next time I might add a few more peas, just cause I liked them in it and wanted a few more, but basically this recipe is great as is!

First time making this recipe, so I followed it exactly. Concerns: prep time was much longer (washing/slicing mushrooms, dicing onions, chopping up turkey,) .... took me 30 minutes; and at times confusing ( just give us the ounces of cream cheese and ounces of noodles).

This was a great way to finish off Thanksgiving Turkey! The flavor was delightful and the topping was so crunchy :). I save the end of my potato chips to use in place of bread crumbs, I especially like the jalapeño ones. These add a little kick to whatever I’m baking. I will definitely be making this again maybe even with chicken.
good use of leftovers
Not my favorite. Came out looking amazing, but the flavor is a little off. I think it is the cream cheese instead of something like mushroom soup or sour cream. Would not make it again

was great but I did make changes so I'm not sure it is really fair to rate it as is. I used cream of mushroom soup because I was in a hurry. Lots of garlic power and put mozzarella on top instead of bread crumbs. The turkey was roasted with an herb crust and the additional flavor was welcome. 4 stars is only because I altered it so much. Don't really know how the original would have tasted.
Delicious! The nutmeg was the magic ingredient that makes this dish so yummy! What an excellent way to use leftover turkey??
Good recipe as written. I added more seasoning like salt and pepper after I made it as it was a little blah.
Will definitely make this again. I may add a few things to spice it up a bit.

I made this DELICIOUS recipe with the modification from Lola650, that is I doubled the topping. My daughter roasted the Thanksgiving turkey at her home and shared the three cups with me. I made the Turkey Tetrazzini for Sunday dinner, and everyone loved it.
One of my favorites
Was a great casserole for leftover turkey. I used extra topping and had enough to share this meal.
No changes. I will make again
We loved it! I think I followed the recipe almost exactly, except for leaving out the mushrooms due to a picky eater in the family. It's good comfort food.

Very tasty way to use cooked turkey. I added more milk,as my sauce was a bit thick. I used panko bread crumbs for extra crunch, but I think that took away from the flavor. So crunch vs flavor. I’ll try regular next time
Husband loved it. It was ok for me. Would like to try one without canned soup. Added fresh mushrooms and spinach with was a nice touch
No changes...
I really liked this recipe. It had some nice flavor. A great way to use those Thanksgiving leftovers.
Add 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder. Delicious!

This was a great dish, but it took a little longer than expected! Lol. I forgot to get mushrooms and the celery I already had suddenly disappeared, so I had to improvise with cream of celery soup and cream of mushroom soup. I didn't have any nutmeg or cream cheese either. It was still delicious!
I made this as written. This was so bland the bf and I both didn't even finish.

Made it exactly as written, except I only had garlic and herb bread crumbs which made a tasty topping. I cooked the entire 8 oz. bag of egg noodles and used all of them. Excellent recipe. Would be great with chicken or even tuna. Will definitely make again.
I didnt have peas or onions on hand plus my kids dont mind about the peas! :)
This was a wonderful dinner!! The only thing I did different was omit the peas. I served fresh green beans on the side ..my husband loved it!! Next time I'll make extra sauce!
I made a large batch of this and boy did it disappear. Everyone loved it.
Have not made it as it doesn't give number of servings.

Came out wonderful. We did not have any mushrooms and instead of bread crumbs I used unseasoned stuffing cubes. I had a half bag left over so I used them. It tasted wonderful. I will definitely make this again.
Great use for leftover turkey.
I used garlic powder on the onion mix. Added pepper at three stages.
I think there must have been an error in this recipe. It calls for 3 1/2 cups of milk. While the flavor was good it was extremely soupy. I think 1/2 cup of milk may be more appropriate.
the cat's meow
The "something" this needs is peppers---your choice of color, but traditionally green. "Try it, you'll like it!"
The "something" this needs is peppers---your choice of color, but traditionally green. "Try it, you'll like it!"
Great!!!

Sweet baby Jesus. I just got done cooking tanksgiving for over 20 people and now to follow these instructions??!?! I’m taking whatever leftover I have and throwing that away. No more turkey until 2019.
It thought it was pretty bland. Maybe needs some cheddar cheese or maybe some Swiss. Definitely needs something.
Really Yummy! I added 3 cloves of garlic and extra parmesan and salt to the sauce. I also used thin spaghetti instead of egg noodles.
This is a great base recipe for leftovers. Leave out the noodles, and sub crushed pork rinds for breadcrumbs, and you've got yourself a low-carb/keto meal.
Everyone love this!

IT WAS A LITTLE DRY ESPECIALLY WHEN REHEATING. I ONLY USED SALT & PEPPER TO TASTE AND UPPED THE PEPPER TO 3 TSP. I USED FRESHLY GROUND COARSE PEPPER. ALSO ADDED A BIT MORE SALT. BEFORE PUTTING IN BAKING PAN, TASTE, AND ADJUST YOUR SPICES. I LIKED THE EGG NOODLES OVER PASTA WHICH I'VE USED BEFORE.
My family is not a fan of peas, so I substituted green beans. I also halved the recipes since we are a small family. Came out great!
There were a lot of ingredients but it was Awesome! I used Fine Linguini instead of egg noodles. My Mom isn't a big pasta eater. It delicious! Thanks!

It did take a full hour, but it was worth it. Yes, lots of dirty pans, but it was worth it. My husband loved it (except the topping which is fine...he can give me his because I love it!) I WILL be making this again!
Followed the recipe exactly. It had a different taste that I think was the ginger. Don't think I would make it again unless I modified this recipe.
This was pretty good but the nutmeg seemed to over power. I would leave it out next time.

Great recipe, although I did kick it up a notch and added a bay leaf, basil, and thyme to the onions and celery. I also added about a quarter cup of white wine before putting it in the oven. Delicious!!!
It was an awesome recipe. My husband loved it also and left me a note telling so.

The first night it was pretty good, but the leftovers were not that great (and it made a LOT). It seemed to lack flavor, even with the addition of more worstershire sauce, and the nutmeg gave it a taste I disliked. Another change included doing spaghetti noodles instead of egg noodles. If I make this again, I will have to tweak it a bit and maybe make half the amount.

I substituted chicken instead of turkey.
I found the recipe lacked pizzazz. It needed Worcestershire sauce..
My husband loved it, no leftovers!
I made this the other night with leftover roasted chicken. I didn't change anything and I thought it was very good and even better the second day!
Delicious. Added a little dry Worcestershire seasoning and 4 cups milk instead of 3 1/2. Perfect! Yum!
I made this with chicken and served the Tetrazzini sauce over the noodles so it stayed very moist and creamy. Thanks.
Not a recipe I would repeat without doing several changes. Since I don't agree with saying "how good it was, but I changed this and this and this", I will just leave my review at not so likeable.
I added a bit more veggies and it was awesome I would make it again for sure
Would make it again. Very good but took longer than I expected

It's delicious, except I changed a few things because I didn't have all the ingredients in my kitchen...

I look at this as a "leftover" recipe, but I didn't have all the ingredients it called for. I made it exactly by the recipe except I didn't have celery, mushrooms or cream cheese. So I made it exactly as written except I omitted the mushrooms and celery, and I substituted 1/2 cup of shredded parmesan for the cream cheese. I did everything else as written.

It's absolutely delicious, and it would have only been better if I'd had the celery, mushrooms and cream cheese and followed the recipe exactly. But if you're missing a few ingredients as I was, just use this recipe as a guide and make the best dish you can. We all loved it!
Pretty bland. Not sure I would make it again.
This got rave reviews from my family. Actually added green beans as we had no peas. Came out great.
This is the exact recipe that was on the Milk Calendar in 1994. Have been making it for years and it is excellent!
Texture and appearance was great and my husband loved it. I personally thought it was very bland.

I made this for dinner last night and let me tell you it is a winner!!!! My husband loved it and so did I. The only thing I did different was intsead of breadcrumbs for the topping I crushed up seasoned crutons for a crunchier topping. The next time I make this I plan to to use 4 cups of milk for the sauce because I thought it was a little dry after baking.

I made this exactly as written, and it was pretty good, though I think it needs a little more spices. It was also a little drier than we would like a casserole to be so I might make extra sauce next time. Otherwise, definitely a thumbs up and a great way to use up some of that extra turkey from the holidays.

I really enjoy turkey tetrazzini to help me deal with Thanksgiving leftovers. And this was pretty good; I liked the egg noodles instead of the spaghetti I have typically used. There was nothing exciting about the flavor, though. 
This took much longer to assemble and prepare than I expected it to, and I dirtied so many dishes to make it. I was glad that I read through the recipe before I started, or I would have taken even longer to make the dish. All ingredients need to be chopped, measured, etc., before you begin.
I added Sherry. I can't believe you left it out! And cream cheese with milk is no sub for whipping cream. Parm in with the Panko crumbs along with a bit of butter is fine.
